job.name: Azure_HDInsight_Delete_Spark_Cluster

variable.name: SUBSCRIPTION_ID
variable.description: The subscription id of your Microsoft Azure account.

variable.name: TENANT_ID
variable.description: The tenant id of your Microsoft Azure account.

variable.name: APP_ID
variable.description: ID of a HDInsights client application.

variable.name: PASSWORD
variable.description: Secret key needed to access a HDInsight client application.

variable.name: AUTHENTICATION_ENDPOINT
variable.description: Hidden variable that contains the authentication endpoint of Azure REST API.

variable.name: MANAGEMENT_ENDPOINT
variable.description: Hidden variable that contains the REST endpoint for managing Azure HDInsight clusters.

variable.name: RESOURCE_GROUP_NAME
variable.description: Hidden variable that contains the name of the Resource Group where the Spark cluster is deployed. If the value of this variable is changed, it must be also changed in the workflows 'Azure_HDInsight_Create_Spark_Cluster' and 'Azure_HDInsight_Scale_Spark_Cluster'.

variable.name: DEPLOYMENT_NAME
variable.description: Hidden variable that contains the name of the Deployment of the Spark cluster. If the value of this variable is changed, it must be also changed in the workflow 'Azure_HDInsight_Create_Spark_Cluster'.

variable.name: CLUSTER_NAME
variable.description: Name of the Spark cluster to be deleted.

variable.name: PROACTIVE_NODE_SOURCE_NAME
variable.description: Name of the Node Source for ProActive nodes that are deployed in the Spark cluster.

job.description: A workflow that uses directly Azure REST API to delete a HDInsight Spark Cluster. Rather, use the Workflow AzureHDInsight_Spark_Send_Signal${SIGNAL_TO_SEND} to achieve the operation through the Job managing the HDInsight cluster.

task.name: hdinsight_delete_spark_cluster
task.description: A task performing a DELETE request to Azure HDInsight REST API in order to undeploy the Spark cluster, which name is given as input. This task requires the Azure authentication token provided the task "azure_authenticate_new".

variable.name: ENDPOINT
variable.description: Base URL of the server or service that will be queried.

variable.name: PATH
variable.description: Path of the request (relative to the base url)

variable.name: SSL_DISABLE_CHECK
variable.description: If true, disable SSL certificate verification

variable.name: CONTENT_TYPE
variable.description: Content-Type of the request

variable.name: REQUEST_BODY
variable.description: A JSON parameter containing the request body.

variable.name: DEBUG
variable.description: If true, print the full request and response content in the task output.

variable.name: RESPONSE_PATH
variable.description: Which data to extract in the response if json, xml or html format is selected. It uses the GPath notation

variable.name: HEADER_Authorization
variable.description: HTTP Authorization request header that contains the credentials to authenticate the user to the server

task.name: azure_authenticate
task.description: A task performing a POST request to Azure REST API in order to authenticate to Azure and acquire an authentication token.

variable.name: ENDPOINT
variable.description: Base URL of the server or service that will be queried.

variable.name: PATH
variable.description: Path of the request (relative to the base url)

variable.name: SSL_DISABLE_CHECK
variable.description: If true, disable SSL certificate verification

variable.name: CONTENT_TYPE
variable.description: Content-Type of the request

variable.name: REQUEST_BODY
variable.description: A JSON parameter containing the request body.

variable.name: DEBUG
variable.description: If true, print the full request and response content in the task output.

variable.name: RESPONSE_FORMAT
variable.description:
Format of the response, either:
  • string: plain text
  • json: a json response which will be parsed using RESPONSE_PATH
  • xml: a xml response which will be parsed using RESPONSE_PATH
  • html
    • : an html response which will be parsed using RESPONSE_PATH
  • contentView: the response will be stored in raw format, and the response content-type will be used for previewing (suitable for binary formats such as files, images, pdf documents, etc)

variable.name: RESPONSE_PATH
variable.description: Which data to extract in the response if json, xml or html format is selected. It uses the GPath notation

task.name: hdinsight_delete_spark_deployment
task.description: A task performing a DELETE request to Azure HDInsight REST API in order to remove the deployment, which name is given as input. This task requires the Azure authentication token provided the task "azure_authenticate_new".

variable.name: ENDPOINT
variable.description: Base URL of the server or service that will be queried.

variable.name: PATH
variable.description: Path of the request (relative to the base url)

variable.name: SSL_DISABLE_CHECK
variable.description: If true, disable SSL certificate verification

variable.name: REQUEST_BODY
variable.description: A JSON parameter containing the request body.

variable.name: DEBUG
variable.description: If true, print the full request and response content in the task output.

variable.name: RESPONSE_PATH
variable.description: Which data to extract in the response if json, xml or html format is selected. It uses the GPath notation

variable.name: HEADER_Authorization
variable.description: HTTP Authorization request header that contains the credentials to authenticate the user to the server

task.name: hdinsight_delete_spark_resource_group
task.description: A task performing a DELETE request to Azure HDInsight REST API in order to remove the resource group, which name is given as input. This task requires the Azure authentication token provided the task "azure_authenticate_new".

variable.name: ENDPOINT
variable.description: Base URL of the server or service that will be queried.

variable.name: PATH
variable.description: Path of the request (relative to the base url)

variable.name: SSL_DISABLE_CHECK
variable.description: If true, disable SSL certificate verification

variable.name: CONTENT_TYPE
variable.description: Content-Type of the request

variable.name: REQUEST_BODY
variable.description: A JSON parameter containing the request body.

variable.name: DEBUG
variable.description: If true, print the full request and response content in the task output.

variable.name: RESPONSE_PATH
variable.description: Which data to extract in the response if json, xml or html format is selected. It uses the GPath notation

variable.name: HEADER_Authorization
variable.description: HTTP Authorization request header that contains the credentials to authenticate the user to the server

task.name: hdinsight_get_spark_cluster_info
task.description: A task that performs iteratively a GET request to Azure HDInsight REST API, in order to get information about the cluster deployment status. If the deployment status is "Succeeded". The cluster Web UI, SSH host and SSH port are extracted and provided as job results, then the loop stops. This task requires the Azure authentication token provided the task "azure_authenticate".

variable.name: ENDPOINT
variable.description: Base URL of the server or service that will be queried.

variable.name: PATH
variable.description: Path of the request (relative to the base url)

variable.name: SSL_DISABLE_CHECK
variable.description: If true, disable SSL certificate verification

variable.name: DEBUG
variable.description: If true, print the full request and response content in the task output.

variable.name: RESPONSE_FORMAT
variable.description:
Format of the response, either:
  • string: plain text
  • json: a json response which will be parsed using RESPONSE_PATH
  • xml: a xml response which will be parsed using RESPONSE_PATH
  • html
    • : an html response which will be parsed using RESPONSE_PATH
  • contentView: the response will be stored in raw format, and the response content-type will be used for previewing (suitable for binary formats such as files, images, pdf documents, etc)

variable.name: RESPONSE_PATH
variable.description: Which data to extract in the response if json, xml or html format is selected. It uses the GPath notation

variable.name: HEADER_Authorization
variable.description: HTTP Authorization request header that contains the credentials to authenticate the user to the server

script.code:
import groovy.json.*
def clusterState = variables.get("CLUSTER_STATE")
slurper = new JsonSlurper()
jsonData = slurper.parseText(JsonOutput.toJson(result))
clusterState=jsonData.properties.clusterState
variables.put("CLUSTER_STATE",clusterState)
println variables.get("CLUSTER_STATE")

def clusterState = variables.get("CLUSTER_STATE")
println("Spark cluster '"+variables.get("CLUSTER_NAME")+ "' is being deleted. No deletion requests will be sent.")
println("Waiting for the Spark cluster and its underlying Resource Group to be deleted ...")

task.name: check_delete_operation
task.description: A task that performs iteratively a GET request to Azure HDInsight REST API, in order to get information about the cluster deployment status. If the deployment status is "Succeeded". The cluster Web UI, SSH host and SSH port are extracted and provided as job results, then the loop stops. This task requires the Azure authentication token provided the task "azure_authenticate".

variable.name: ENDPOINT
variable.description: Base URL of the server or service that will be queried.

variable.name: PATH
variable.description: Path of the request (relative to the base url)

variable.name: SSL_DISABLE_CHECK
variable.description: If true, disable SSL certificate verification

variable.name: DEBUG
variable.description: If true, print the full request and response content in the task output.

variable.name: HEADER_Authorization
variable.description: HTTP Authorization request header that contains the credentials to authenticate the user to the server
